keywords.value: Hague Conference on Private International Law (HCCH)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A committee of the Idaho Legislature has refused to act on a bill that would enable the United States to take part in a global enforcement pact.

headline.print_headline: Idaho Resists Global Pact and May See Funding Cut
headline.main: Negotiated at The Hague, a Child Support Treaty Falters in Boise

snippet: A committee of the Idaho Legislature has refused to act on a bill that would enable the United States to take part in a global enforcement pact.
abstract: Idaho legislators reject multinational child support bill that would ease process of tracking down delinquent parents around world, effectively killing participation of United States in legislation that requires approval of all 50 states; move carries serious implications for parents across country and in Idaho, which will lose federal support for its child welfare system as result.
